channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PDFBOX-4604] Used type0 for cyrillic, losting font on android
item.description:
Debugging with pdfbox-app-2.0.16.jar created pdf with java api 2.0.12 after click on loaded .ttf as type0 return unlimited looks like encoding exception, and interface lock

Method loading:

PDType0Font.load(outPDDocument, readResource(FONT_FILENAME));

Because of this fonts lost on android device. To work around this error i created pdf with all symbol on google docs, and getting good font type0.
item.summary: Used type0 for cyrillic, losting font on android

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
What do you mean with "type0 return unlimited"?

"looks like encoding exception" - no, this is an INFO message, no exception. It means that your font doesn't have proper unicode mappings. This is only important if you want text extraction.

"interface lock" - do you mean that the Android application became unresponsive?

"Because of this fonts lost on android device." - what is "lost"? Does this mean the fonts are not displayed on Android? If yes, what application did you use to display the PDF?

Please clarify what role Android plays here. pdfbox-app-2.0.16.jar doesn't run on Android.

The second screenshot you shared is of PDFDebugger. What does it prove? All I can see that the font is not embedded. Which may bring problems if the software used for display isn't very good.

Please share the file that was created with 2.0.12. (Can you create the PDF with 2.0.16, and what is the result?)

Look damage.pdf 

" no, this is an INFO message" - Info message sending infinitely in console, and interface hangs.

"The second screenshot you shared is of PDFDebugger" - This screenshot was wrong sent.

"Please clarify what role Android plays here" - We generating pdf for all devices, include Android phone. But on Android pdf not work.

Used viewer on Android:
Google PDF Viewer,
Driver PDF Viewer,
Adobe Acrobar

Thank you, now I understand. One of the problems is that you have too many log messages. Here's the ones I get:

 Warning  [PDType0Font] No Unicode mapping for CID+20 (20) in font CourierNewPSMT

I'll fix this by avoid the repetition of the warning. After the change it would look like this:

 Warning  [PDType0Font] No Unicode mapping for CID+20 (20) in font CourierNewPSMT
 Warning  [PDCIDFontType2] Failed to find a character mapping for 20 in CourierNewPSMT

However looking at the font itself with PDFDebugger will still be slow (but less than before).

The cause for the viewing troubles is that your font CourierNewPSMT (see at Root/Pages/Kids/[0]/Resources/Font/F3/DescendantFonts/[0] with PDFDebugger) is not embedded (I wonder how this is possible - PDFBox always embeds). PDFBox and the Android viewers then try some workarounds and all fail, maybe because the mobile devices doesn't have the Cyrillic glyphs.

Adobe Reader for desktop is able to display the file, but text extraction fails for the table contents. Same for PDFBox.

From looking at the content streams, I suspect that your PDF was written twice. First the table, then the contents of the table. The second step was incorrectly done. Maybe with another software, maybe it is a new bug, or maybe some person removed the embedded font with brute force.

Setting to resolved after getting no reaction on my comments of July 24. But the changes I made will still be an improvement on speed due to having less logging on troublesome files.
